column2: ALABAMA DRIVERS PERMIT TEST
column6: AL

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. What does this road sign indicate?
column4: Drivers have the right of way over bikes turning left.
column6: Vehicles turning left must yield to bikes entering a right turn lane.
column8: Motor vehicles entering an exclusive right-turn lane must weave across bicycle traffic in bicycle lanes.

column2: 2. Regulation signs normally are ____ rectangles with ____ letters or symbols.
column6: white; black

column2: 3. You should use turn signals to indicate your intention with sufficient time to allow other drivers to see the signal:
column6: AFTER you move.

column2: 4. This sign means:
column4: Business area nearby. Watch for business people.
column6: There is a work zone ahead. Watch for workers.
column8: The driver is near a school and should watch for children.

column2: 5. If you are feeling tired while driving, you should:
column6: open a window.

column2: 6. Blocking an intersection during rush hour traffic is not permitted:
column6: unless you entered the intersection on a green light.

column2: 7. Blind spots around a large vehicle are _________________ than the blind spots around a car.
column6: less dangerous

column2: 8. Construction zone signs are generally:
column6: triangular with black and yellow coloring.
column8: diamond or rectangular with orange and black coloring.

column2: 9. A red arrow on a traffic light means:
column4: You may not turn in the direction of the arrow until a green light or arrow light goes on.
column6: You may turn in in the direction of the arrow after coming to a complete stop.
column8: You must stop and then proceed when the way is clear.

column2: 10. This sign warns drivers that:
column6: they will soon be facing oncoming traffic.

column2: 11. __________________ is a safe driving technique.
column4: Using your high beam lights in the fog
column6: Starring at the road ahead of your vehicle

column2: 12. The ‘One Way’ sign means that:
column4: only vehicles turning left may travel in the direction of the arrow.
column6: there is only one road that turns left at the intersection.
column8: drivers may travel only in the direction of the arrow.

column2: 13. You may drive faster than the posted speed limit:
column4: when passing another vehicle, as long as it is safe to do so.
column6: when your lane is empty.

column2: 14. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, if the road you enter has two lanes, you:
column4: must turn into its right lane.
column6: can not turn left.
column8: must turn into its left lane.

column2: 15. Who is most at risk?
column6: Drivers who are driving on long, boring roads.

column2: 16. Yellow traffic signs:
column6: when combined with an octagonal shape, tell drivers they must come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column2: 17. A driver who's being passed on the right and the left by many vehicles while driving in the center lane of an highway should:
column6: move to the lane on their right.
column8: move to the lane on their left.

column2: 18. Before passing a vehicle or changing lanes, remember to:
column4: only pass or change lanes if the change can be completed  without speeding.
column6: signal your return to the left lane.
column8: sound your horn as you pass.

column2: 19. This road sign means:
column4: There is a series of sharp turns up ahead on the road
column6: Sharp right turn ahead.
column8: A road joins from the right

column2: 20. This road sign means:
column6: Warning, curves ahead
column8: Do not use your brakes in this area

column2: 21. When riding in a vehicle equipped with air bags is, children ages 12 and under are safer:
column4: buckled up in the back seat.
column6: in the bed of a pick-up truck.
column8: buckled up in the front seat.

column2: 22. Road signs that direct drivers to services are:
column6: blue and white.

column2: 23. A driver distraction is anything that:
column6: causes excessive concentration while driving.
column8: takes the attention away from driving.

column2: 24. This sign means:
column6: Merge right

column2: 25. After passing a vehicle, it is safe to return to your lane when:
column4: the driver you passed slows down to let you return to your lane.
column6: you can see both headlights of the vehicle you just passed in your rearview mirror.
column8: you are at least 100 feet ahead of the vehicle you passed.

column2: 26. What should drivers do when they see this sign?
column4: Make sure the bridge is clear of oncoming traffic before they cross.
column6: Look to the left and right for other traffic.

column2: 27. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: left and right turns are not allowed.
column6: a divided highway is ahead.

column2: 28. When drivers see the ‘Wrong Way’ sign:
column4: they are going the wrong way on an expressway exit ramp.
column6: they must drive past this sign and reach the next intersection.
column8: they must not leave the pavement except in an emergency.

column2: 29. Which of the following is a defensive driving skill/technique?
column6: Do not drive if you are very weary.

column2: 30. You face a green light, but traffic on the other side of the intersection does not allow you to travel all the way through the intersection. What must you do?
column4: Enter the intersection and wait until traffic ahead clears.
column6: Wait for the next green light.
column8: Wait until traffic ahead clears, so you do not block the intersection.

column2: 31. ___________ are green with white letters and symbols.
column6: Destination signs (guide signs)

column2: 32. Which of the following is a common cause of traffic collisions?
column4: Scanning the road ahead and staying focused on the driving task.
column6: Driving too fast for conditions.
column8: Pedestrians being key participants in the transportation system.

column2: 33. This road sign means:
column6: Merging traffic

column2: 34. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: there is a right turn ahead.
column6: they must stay on the right side of the divider

column2: 35. The yield sign is ___ and white, with ___ letters.
column6: red; red

column2: 36. A driver who approaches an intersection:
column4: must yield the right-of-way to traffic already in the intersection.
column6: must drive straight through the intersection, even if another vehicle is already in the intersection.
column8: has the right-of-way over traffic already in the intersection.

column2: 37. Which shape is a stop sign?
column6: Octagon

column2: 38. The sign in the picture:
column4: is a Construction and Maintenance Traffic Control sign.
column6: is found at most intersections and indicates that drivers must yield to other vehicles.
column8: is displayed on the rear of slow moving vehicles.

column2: 39. This sign indicates:
column6: A no-passing zone

column2: 40. What does it mean If an oncoming driver flashes headlights at you during a period of low visibility?
column4: Your headlights are too bright. You should turn them off.
column6: Your vehicle was difficult to see. You should turn on your headlights.
column8: Your headlights are too bright. You should use parking lights instead.
